snippet: The authors of rosy newsletters conspired with the owners of penny stocks to hype nearly worthless companies, officials say.
abstract: Eight people are indicted on charges they defrauded thousands of investors of more than $290 million from April 2009 to May 2012, using emailed newsletters to hype nearly worthless companies; stock promoters Anthony Thompson, Eric Van Nguyen and Jay Fung are accused of conspiring with company officials to drive up prices of penny stocks.
lead_paragraph: The authors of rosy newsletters conspired with the owners of penny stocks to hype nearly worthless companies, officials say.

headline.main: $290 Million Lost in Penny Stock Fraud, Prosecutors Say
headline.print_headline: $290 Million Lost in Penny Stock Fraud, Prosecutors Say
